title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 22 August 2009 - XWiki
content:
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:05): help  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:05): [Vincent Massol] bot is back and working, enjoy :)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:05): [Vincent Massol] logging is active again  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:05): search index  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:06): [Vincent Massol] you can check logs here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/xwikiArchive20090822  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:06): [Vincent Massol] hmm missing user  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:06): [Vincent Massol] ah no that's only for bot commands  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:08): [arunreddy] Hi Vincent, Am finding it little tough to load the dump into memory and parse it from here. ( Using ZipInputStream Reader ).  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:09): [Vincent Massol] don't load it in memory it's going to fail with big zipsq  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:09): [Vincent Massol] zips  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:09): [Vincent Massol] you need to read it as a stream  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:10): [Vincent Massol] but not save it in memmory  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:10): [arunreddy] I tried reading the data as bytes into input stream and passing the same to SAX Reader and it fails.  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:10): [Vincent Massol] yes that's easy  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:11): [Vincent Massol] there are several examples of reading zips using ZipInputStream in the xwiki code base or on the net if you want to see how it's done  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:12): [Vincent Massol] for those interested the main pb with the bot was that it wasn't setting up an Execution Context in Pircbot's thread so it was unull  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:12): [Vincent Massol] s/unull/null/  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:12): [Vincent Massol] I have also groovified and refactored it quite a lot  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:13): search Pircbot  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:13): search "Am finding it little tough"  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:13): [Vincent Massol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:14): [glerouge] lol  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:14): [glerouge] well done  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:14): [Vincent Massol] all commands are working too :)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:15): [Vincent Massol] thanks, took me a while  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:15): [Vincent Massol] debugging groovy written in a wiki page on a remote server is hard  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:16): [glerouge] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:16): [Vincent Massol] and no the bespin editor doesn't help!  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:16): [lucaa] thanks for logging & searching Vincent. And proving how open protocols rock :)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:16): [glerouge] you did it!  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:16): [Vincent Massol] anca  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:17): [Vincent Massol] this is still using the irc bot  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:17): [Vincent Massol] (it's too early to do a jabber bot before we decide if we switch to jabber or not)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:18): [lucaa] yes, we probably could have written the bridge in skype too... but we didn't try that much though...  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:18): [Vincent Massol] I looked at that  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:18): [lucaa] irc is open too, isn't it?  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:18): [Vincent Massol] but I haven't found any solution other than on windows  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:18): [lucaa] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:18): [Vincent Massol] irc is open yes  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:18): [glerouge] is there a way to make a panel work whatever the syntax of the page ?  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:18): [glerouge] I would like to upgrade the SendPageByMail application  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:19): [glerouge] are panels intepreted with the syntax of the currently rendered doc or their own document syntax ?  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:20): [Vincent Massol] own doc syntax AFAIR  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:20): [lucaa] glerouge: although I didn't check, I think it's their own doc. things would fall terribly apart if it didn't  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:20): [Vincent Massol] let me check, it's in macros.vm  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:20): [glerouge] ok, thx  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:20): [Vincent Massol]       $!doc.display("content", "view", $pobj, $paneldoc.getSyntaxId())  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:21): [Vincent Massol] so yes  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:21): [Vincent Massol] using the panel doc syntax  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:21): [Vincent Massol] I implemented that some time back  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:21): [Vincent Massol] in order to be independent  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:21): [Vincent Massol] of the main content  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:22): [glerouge] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:23): [glerouge] no need to update it  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:23): [glerouge] it still works :)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:24): [lucaa] glerouge: now that's was fast  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:24): [lucaa] /s/that's/that  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:24): [glerouge] lol  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:25): [glerouge] I can prove it  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:25): [Vincent Massol] that's because we're good and taking good care of backward compat ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:27): [glerouge] lucaa: check your mailbox  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:27): [Vincent Massol] that reminds me of when I was learning to code back in '82 :)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:28): [glerouge] wasn't even born  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:28): [lucaa] me neither  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:29): [glerouge] there's actually one bug in my application, it doesn't include page comments even when they should be  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:29): [Vincent Massol] it's a nice feeling to see that what you created works and has a life on its own  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:29): [Vincent Massol] ok time for shower.... bbl  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:29): search Container  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:30): [lucaa] Vincent Massol: yeah, you're getting all sentimental...   
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:30): [Vincent Massol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:30): [glerouge] he is  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:30): news  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:31): [glerouge] the shower is an excuse to get out of here before he starts telling us tales of developing when Maven didn't exist  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:31): [Vincent Massol] ah yes good topic  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:31): [glerouge] "in the time you known when there wasn't the continuous build and such"  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:31): [Vincent Massol] once upon a day  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:31): [Vincent Massol] there was a tool called Ant  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:31): [Vincent Massol] ....  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:32): [glerouge] marius, you re here just in time for a story of continuos build  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:32): [Vincent Massol] it was back in the drak ages  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:32): [Vincent Massol] dark  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:32): [Vincent Massol] when evil spirits ruled over the land  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:32): [lucaa] and bugs were swarming over the shiny skies of code  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:33): [Vincent Massol] the was a group of brave warriors who decided to put an end to this  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:33): [anamarias] this channel is a lot more interesting than IRC :)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:33): [Vincent Massol] s/the/there/  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:34): [glerouge] anamarias: and you've only seen a beginning ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:34): [Vincent Massol] (pause time, I'll tell you the end of the story tomorrow kids)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:35): [arunreddy] Oh, that's not fair  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:36): [lucaa] no no, tell us what happened to the brave warriors, come ooooooo oon  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:36): [arunreddy] :P  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:36): [anamarias] ah no ! :)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:36): [arunreddy] The brave warriors ...  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:38): [glerouge] (vincent needs to build suspense otherwise we won't believe him when he will tell us he was one of the warriors)  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:38): [anamarias] :))  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:38): [mflorea] guillaume, actually I was wondering why macros don't have any category set and if someone is planning to add them before the release. I'd like to test the macro dialog.  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:40): [glerouge] I don't know  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:40): [glerouge] I guess that"s because we didn't close the vote on macro categories names  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:40): [glerouge] only vincent & I replied  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:41): [mflorea] ok, replying now  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:41): [glerouge] does it work when you create a new macro in a wiki page and assign it a category ?  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:41): [mflorea] I haven't tested yet  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:41): [glerouge] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:42): [glerouge] vincent or asiri or thomas will probably add the categories to each macro once the vote is closed  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 14:42): [glerouge] until then you'll have to modify your local build I guess  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 15:02): [mflorea] Vincent & Thomas: MacroCategoryManager is buggy.. I added a wiki macro and set its default category to "Foo". The category manager includes all the macros in this category and also includes my new macro in the other (null) category.. this needs to be fixed asap. I'll check with the latest sources.  
xwiki-bridge - (22/08/2009 15:32): [Vincent Massol] page notification doesn't seem to be working for some reason, checking
